intro: Vincetoxicum gracilipes, commonly known as slender false bindweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it can become a weed in certain environments.
